ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

0=Normal or baseline speech; conversive and appropriate; 1=Imperfect speech; answers most questions appropriately; 2=Slurred speech; answers few questions appropriately; 3=Slurred speech; does not make sense; 4=Unable to cooperate; unintelligible speech or only moans
0=Can stand and walk and is steady; 1=Can stand or walk, but is unsteady; 2=Can sit up and is steady, but cannot stand; 3=Can sit up, but is unsteady; 4=Unable to cooperate; cannot sit up

0=No nystagmus; follows finger with eyes whole time; 1=Minimal nystagmus; unable to follow finger with eyes; 2=Moderate nystagmus; only follows finger with eyes for short distance; 3=Profound nystagmus; unable to follow finger with eyes; 4=Unable to participate

ElementDescription: Rate nystagmus and finger to target:
Notes: 0=Steady; accurate finger to target; 1=Steady; inaccurate but touches target; 2=Unsteady; inaccurate/barely touches target; 3=Grossly unsteady; misses finger to target; 4=Unable to participate
0=Traces curve perfectly; 1=Traces mostly inside lines; 2=Traces mostly outside of line; 3=Makes mark on paper; 4=Unable to participate
Sum of the 5 items in the Hack Impairment Index(HII)
